snippet: The state’s need to abolish capital punishment is obvious with the flawed case of Terrance Williams, a death row inmate.
abstract: Editorial argues that Pennsylvania should abolish capital punishment, citing the case of Terrance Williams, who may become the first person in 50 years to be put to death in the state while fighting his sentence; notes that there were serious flaws in the case against Williams, including the continued use of witness testimony that was later recanted.
lead_paragraph: The state’s need to abolish capital punishment is obvious with the flawed case of Terrance Williams, a death row inmate.
